intro: Pleurothallis arietina, commonly known as the "Red-veined Orchid," is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, velvety green leaves with red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often clustered in a loose inflorescence. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and ease of care.
